Description: The study of the human body is a personally rewarding and increasingly important field in today’s world. Health and Movement studies take a practical, hands-on approach. This degree combines courses in health, movement and science, and a major in community health or sport, to help you arrive at a complete, real-world understanding of your field.
Career_Outcomes: Community Sports Manager / Community Recreation Manager / Sports Administrator / Sports Development Officer
Subject_or_Unit_4: Skill Acquisition
Subject_or_Unit_17: Introduction to Understanding Community Health Research
Subject_or_Unit_19: Introduction to understanding Sport and Fitness Research
Subject_or_Unit_22: Health, Lifestyle, Disease and Exercise Prescription

Description: The Bachelor of Health Science (Fitness) course allows you to concentrate your studies in health science with a fitness major to appeal to your interests and career aspirations. You will build a comprehensive understanding of human biomedical science underpinned by fitness industry skills. Plus it will provide the practice of this knowledge in client assessments and in designing, implementing and evaluating exercise programs.
Career_Outcomes: Specialist Exercise Advisor / Strength and Conditioning Coach / High Performance Manager / Gym and Facility Manager
Subject_or_Unit_3: Application of Maths and Statistics for Health and Sport
Subject_or_Unit_4: Fitness Principles and Programming
Subject_or_Unit_8: Introduction to Performance and Exercise Psychology
Subject_or_Unit_22: Health, Lifestyle Disease and Exercise Prescription
Subject_or_Unit_24: Exercise & Social Development through the Lifespan

Course: Undergraduate Certificate in Fundamentals of Health Promotion
Description: The Undergraduate Certificate in Fundamentals of Health Promotion is designed to develop an understanding of the social, environmental, political and economic determinants of health. Students will learn the core domains of health promotion including how to plan, advocate, and evaluate policies and programs to bring positive changes to the health of communities using a preventative model. This course is designed for professionals working in Fitness, Allied Health, Health Care or Physical Education looking to upskill or retrain.
Career_Outcomes: Students will develop the skills to work professionally in health promotion careers. These roles may include a Health Promotion Officer or Coordinator, Health & Lifestyle Coordinator, Policy Support Officer, Community Health Development Officer, Community Engagement Officer, Public Health Project Officer, Environmental Health Coordinator, Health and Wellbeing Manager and other positions within government, private or NGOs.
Subject_or_Unit_1: Foundations of Dance (Work Integrated Learning – WIL)
Subject_or_Unit_4: Application of Maths and Statistics for Health and Sport
Subject_or_Unit_24: Exercise & Social Development through the Lifespan

Course: Undergraduate Certificate in Sport Leadership Development
Description: The Undergraduate Certificate in Sport Leadership Development short course is designed to provide professional upskilling, employment and participation in lifelong learning to those that are either currently working in the business of sport or seeking employment within the industry. This Certificate would therefore allow the students to demonstrate the learning outcomes expressed as knowledge, skills and the application of knowledge as a means to either attain the necessary skills to take on more responsibilities and/or move into leadership positions or to re-engage in the industry in positions requiring key leadership knowledge and skills.
Career_Outcomes: Students will develop the necessary skills to work professionally in careers in the sports industry. These roles may include Sports Administrators, Athlete Talent Managers, Sports Business Development Managers, Athlete Agents, Sports Consultant, Sports Business Research and Development Mangers, Sports . These roles can be in sports governing bodies, sports clubs, player associations government agencies and not-for-profit sports organisations.
Subject_or_Unit_3: Law and Ethics in Sports Administration
Subject_or_Unit_4: Managerial Accounting and Finance Management in Sports Administration
Subject_or_Unit_5: Marketing and Media Relations in Sports Administration
Subject_or_Unit_6: Facility and Event Management in Sport Administration
Subject_or_Unit_17: Performance Analysis and Research in Coaching
Subject_or_Unit_19: Advanced Strength and Conditioning (Work Integrated Learning – WIL)
Subject_or_Unit_23: Advanced Training Principles and Exercise Prescription
